bill_title: Encouraging the Executive Board of the Legislature to establish a taskforce to study the availability of childcare.

bill_versions.bill_text: A CONCURRENT RESOLUTION, Encouraging the Executive Board of the Legislature to establish a taskforce to study the availability of childcare. WHEREAS, there has been a significant decline in the availability of affordable childcare options in South Dakota. South Dakota has one of the highest rates of working parents in the nation; and WHEREAS, the lack of affordable childcare options has prevented many South Dakota parents from entering the workforce, creating financial and emotional hardships for many families, and, in particular, single parents who are trying to balance work and childcare needs; and WHEREAS, the lack of affordable childcare is a barrier for parents trying to return to the workforce during a time when South Dakota is experiencing labor shortages and businesses are in need of employees; and WHEREAS, the childcare crisis is complex, and legislators, representatives from the childcare industry, business leaders, state agencies, and community stakeholders are needed to address the crisis: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, by the House of Representatives of the Ninety-Eighth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, the Senate concurring therein, that the Executive Board of the Legislature is encouraged to establish a taskforce to address the childcare crisis in South Dakota; and BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the taskforce may develop recommendations and draft legislation to increase affordability and access to childcare.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
